intro: Phyllanthus ligustrifolius var. boulindaensis, commonly known as the Boulinda phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly serrated margin. It is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
